_comment: World Generation Configuration - Controls infinite world generation parameters

_documentation.overview: This file controls how the infinite world generates chunks, biomes, resources, and dungeons.
_documentation.biome_system: Uses deterministic noise to create organic biome clusters. The same seed always generates the same world.
_documentation.danger_zones: The world is divided into zones based on distance from spawn. Each zone has different danger levels.
_documentation.resource_spawning: Resources spawn based on chunk danger level. Specific resources per biome are defined in Chunk-templates-2.JSON
_documentation.dungeon_spawning: Dungeon rarity/loot is configured in dungeon-config-1.JSON. This file only controls entrance placement.
_documentation.value_normalization: Percentage values are automatically normalized if they don't sum to 1.0 (dilutive approach)
customization_tips: Increase biome_noise_scale for larger biome regions
Adjust danger_zone_radius to control safe starting area
Modify resource_counts to make the world more or less resource-rich
See Chunk-templates-2.JSON for which specific resources spawn in each biome

chunk_loading._comment: Controls how many chunks are loaded around the player
chunk_loading._load_radius_effects: HIGHER = more chunks loaded (9x9 at 4), more memory, smoother exploration. LOWER = fewer chunks, less memory, more loading.
chunk_loading._spawn_always_loaded_effects: HIGHER = larger always-loaded spawn area. LOWER = only immediate spawn stays loaded.
chunk_loading._chunk_size_warning: DO NOT CHANGE without regenerating world. 16 tiles = 256 tiles per chunk.

biome_distribution._comment: Ratio of each biome type. Values are DILUTIVE - automatically normalized to sum to 1.0
biome_distribution._example: water=2, forest=5, cave=3 becomes water=0.2, forest=0.5, cave=0.3
biome_distribution._water_effects: HIGHER = more lakes/rivers/swamps, more fishing spots. LOWER = more land-based biomes.
biome_distribution._forest_effects: HIGHER = more trees, wood resources dominant. LOWER = more caves/quarries.
biome_distribution._cave_effects: HIGHER = more ore/stone resources. LOWER = more forests.

biome_clustering._comment: Controls how biomes group together using super-region system
_system_description: World is divided into 4x4 chunk super-regions (64x64 tiles each)
Each super-region gets a biome category via deterministic hash
Boundary chunks have 15% chance to blend with neighbors for organic edges
Within categories, type clusters (3-5 chunks) create variety
biome_clustering._super_region_size_effects: NOTE: Hardcoded in biome_generator.py. 4 = 16 chunks per region.
biome_clustering._type_cluster_scale_effects: Controls type clustering within category regions. HIGHER = larger same-type areas.
biome_clustering._danger_noise_scale_effects: HIGHER = larger regions of same danger level. LOWER = more varied danger pockets.

danger_zones._comment: SIMPLIFIED: ±8 chunks from spawn = progressively safer. Beyond = random/fair game.
danger_zones._note: The danger zone logic is hardcoded in biome_generator.py for simplicity. These values are legacy.
_behavior: Beyond distance 8: ~40% peaceful, ~40% dangerous, ~20% rare (no distance bias)
danger_zones._safe_zone_radius_effects: NOTE: Hardcoded to 8 in biome_generator.py. This value is for reference only.
danger_zones._transition_zone_radius_effects: DEPRECATED: No longer used. Danger transitions linearly within safe zone.
danger_zones._max_danger_enabled_effects: DEPRECATED: Beyond safe zone is simply random/fair game.

safe_zone_distribution._comment: DEPRECATED: Now uses progressive formula based on distance.

transition_zone_distribution._comment: DEPRECATED: Merged into safe zone progressive formula.

outer_zone_distribution._comment: Beyond ±8 chunks: random distribution with no distance bias.

spawn_area._comment: Controls the safe starting area around world origin (0,0)
spawn_area._resource_exclusion_effects: HIGHER = larger clear area around spawn. LOWER = resources closer to spawn point.

crafting_station_area._description: Fixed crafting stations spawn north of origin (all tiers T1-T4)

resource_spawning._comment: Controls resource COUNT per chunk. WHICH resources spawn is defined in Chunk-templates-2.JSON
resource_spawning._relationship: This sets min/max counts. Chunk-templates-2.JSON defines specific resource types and densities per biome.

peaceful_chunks._count_effects: HIGHER = more resources per peaceful chunk. LOWER = sparser resources.
peaceful_chunks._tier_effects: HIGHER max tier = rare resources in peaceful areas. Keep low for proper progression.

rare_chunks._count_effects: HIGHER = very resource-rich rare areas. These are already hard to find.

water_chunks._comment: Special settings for water-type chunks (fishing, water subtypes)

normal_water._spots_effects: HIGHER = more fishing opportunities per water chunk.

cursed_swamp._description: Cursed swamps have higher tier fishing but dangerous enemies

water_subtypes._comment: Distribution of water chunk subtypes. Values are DILUTIVE - normalized automatically.
water_subtypes._lake_effects: HIGHER = more lakes (circular water with islands).
water_subtypes._river_effects: HIGHER = more rivers (flowing water with bridges).
water_subtypes._cursed_swamp_effects: HIGHER = more dangerous swamps. Only spawn in rare danger zones.
water_subtypes._cursed_swamp_note: Cursed swamps only appear in rare danger zones regardless of this chance

dungeon_spawning._comment: Controls dungeon ENTRANCE placement. Dungeon content/loot is in dungeon-config-1.JSON
dungeon_spawning._relationship: This file: WHERE dungeons spawn. dungeon-config-1.JSON: WHAT's inside dungeons.
dungeon_spawning._spawn_chance_effects: HIGHER = more dungeons (0.15 = ~1 per 7 chunks). LOWER = rarer dungeons (0.05 = ~1 per 20 chunks).
dungeon_spawning._min_distance_effects: HIGHER = dungeons only far from spawn. LOWER = dungeons can appear closer to spawn.

chunk_unloading._comment: Controls chunk memory management for infinite worlds
chunk_unloading._enabled_effects: FALSE = all chunks stay loaded (high memory usage). TRUE = distant chunks unload.
chunk_unloading._save_modified_effects: TRUE = harvested resources saved/restored. FALSE = resources respawn on reload.
chunk_unloading._track_unload_effects: TRUE = resources respawn based on time away. FALSE = no time-based respawn.

debug._log_chunk_effects: TRUE = verbose chunk generation logging (performance impact).
debug._log_biome_effects: TRUE = log every chunk's biome assignment.
debug._show_seed_effects: TRUE = display world seed in debug mode (F1).
